text: I'm trying to set de color picker to the background of a div. how can i do it?
Thanks I was able to solve and figure it out!

<@U01EBLJ29C2> You just need to add the color picker from the module area and then add it as a style or you can create an specific class with a similar approach.

`<div style="" class="columns-module-item" style="background-color:rgba({{ module.background_color.color|convert_rgb }}, {{ module.background_color.opacity/100 }});">`

`</div>`

<@UH36ZQSD9> Maybe using the after selector on the input something like this
 `input[type=email]::after{`
 `content ="Email*";`
`}`

Does anyone knows if its possible to fill a list of items dinamically, I'm creating a module on which I add general tags, then I create some options and inside of those options I need to use the same tags that I created before, is it possible to select them from inside a repeting group or something, right now what I'm doing is typing them down again, but i'd rather have them duplicate from the items that I added at the beginning
1st picture, General Tags
2nd picture, Inside of the "New Item", thats when I'd like to use the same tags again instead of creating a new option to be filled
I solved with:  style="background-color:rgba({{ item.color_field.color|convert_rgb }}, {{ item.color_field.opacity / 100 }});"
<@UK4FUHGG3> Thanks for that. I will try it out.
